decks.name: Rosie the Riveter
decks.notes:
One of the [design contest](https://restorationgames.com/unmatched-design-contest/) winners, by Chet Dudick & Charles Peters.

From the Restoration [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RestorationGame/status/1370016829322756096):

> Chet, whose daughter is always asking to play a female hero, was committed to doing one for the contest. As we well know, finding good female candidates (that aren't witches) isn't easy. So he took a true feminist icon and figured out a way to make it work in Unmatched.
> As Rosie, you'll build a powerful mech suit. Each upgrade will change how you play as they come on line. So you're always finding new ways to win each game with different configurations. A great puzzle to solve.

decks.name: Moon Knight
decks.notes: Start the game as Moon Knight. You must change to your next form at the end of your turn. Moon Knight, Khonshu, and Mr. Knight all share the same health dial.
decks.special:
##### Moon Knight
At the start of your turn, move up to 2 spaces.

##### Khonshu
Khonshu adds +2 to the value of his attack cards. He does not take damage from effects other than combat damage.

##### Mr. Knight
Mr. Knight adds +1 to all his defense values.

At the end of your turn, change to your next identity (In order, Moon Knight -> Khonshu -> Mr. Knight, repeating).

decks.name: Harry Houdini
decks.notes:
One of the [design contest](https://restorationgames.com/unmatched-design-contest/) winners, by Sam Crane.

From the Restoration [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RestorationGame/status/1369294401718083587):

> We were immediately drawn to the idea of a Houdini deck, a hero who could literally do card tricks while playing a card-driven game. Sam did a great job of realizing this (and Houdini's notoriety as an escape artist) in card effects.
> As Houdini, you'll do things like: making your opponent choose a random card, palming cards, moving cards around, oh, and disappearing and reappearing right next to your opponent. A ton of fun and great contrast to the grandiose effects of his set opponent: The Genie of the Lamp.
decks.special:
ESCAPE ARTIST
When you take the maneuver action and BOOST, you may place Houdini in any space instead of moving. (Bess moves as normal.)

Place Elektra and all Hand back onto the board with each fighter in a different zone. (You must resolve effects with the RESURRECTED symbol.)

decks.name: T. Rex
decks.notes:
Large fighters have an extended base that can occupy up to two spaces. Large fighters may start moving from any space they are in. When they do, rotate them so that the head is moving into the new space. Their tail always follows behind their head, entering the space the left. Large fighters also ignore one-way arrows on maps and cannot use secret passages.
Large fighters can attack up to 2 spaces away, even over fighters that occupy one of those spaces.
decks.special: T-Rex is a large fighter. (She can attack up to 2 spaces away.) At the end of your turn, draw a card.

decks.name: The Genie
decks.notes:
One of the [design contest](https://restorationgames.com/unmatched-design-contest/) winners, by Adil M. Geresu.

From the Restoration [Twitter](https://twitter.com/restorationgame/status/1369709951887814664):

> When we saw a deck for the Genie of the Lamp, we were concerned about power level. I mean, the Genie can literally do anything. That's the genius of Adil's design. He didn't shy away from the power - he leaned into it. The power is the flaw. It's genie-ous.
> As the Genie of the Lamp, you'll find yourself with a wealth of options: extra cards, extra actions, extra everything. You'll throw big attacks and put up big defenses. You'll wonder how you could possibly lose....
> 
> Until you realize the price of power always catches up with you.
decks.quote: What wouldst thou have? - The Genie

decks.name: William Shakespeare
decks.notes:
One of the [design contest](https://restorationgames.com/unmatched-design-contest/) winners, by Jonathan Guberman.

From the Restoration [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RestorationGame/status/1370392596942630912):

> Jonathan is a big Shakespeare fan, so much so that his other entry was one of the Bard's many notable characters. But there's a far cry from designing a fighter that's a vengeful Dane with a sword and the audacity of a hero armed only with a quill. We loved it.
> As Shakespeare, the play's thing -- like, the actual words. I hesitate to reveal the mechanical hook, because it's so delightfully clever. So, all I'll do is drop this quote that encapsulates the game oh so well: "From ancient grudge break to new mutiny."

decks.name: King Arthur
decks.notes:
A ruling clarification has updated that a card is only "cancelled" if one of its effects was actually cancelled.
Excalibur cannot be cancelled because it does not have any card effects. This means that if Arthur BOOSTs Excalibur with his ability, it cannot be discarded.
decks.special:
When King Arthur attacks, you may BOOST that attack. Play the BOOST card, face down, along with your attack card.
If your opponent cancels the effects on your attack card, the BOOST is discarded without effect.

decks.name: Shredder
decks.special:
Master of the Clan
At the start of your turn, deploy a Foot soldier to a path adjacent to a friendly fighter. You may attack opposing fighters adjacent to Foot soldiers. If an opponent boosts their maneuver, they may remove any Foot soldiers their hero moves through.

decks.name: Krang
decks.special:
DOOOOM!
Krang has 3 doomsday machines. Start with one machine active. After you roll the die of epic destruction, you can flip an active machine to reroll the die. Add +1 to your move value for each active machine.

decks.name: Donatello
decks.notes: Invention bonuses cannot be canceled.
decks.set: Unmatched Adventures - Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
decks.special:
Inventive
When you maneuver, you may draw 2 cards instead of 1. If you do, put a card in your hand on the bottom of your deck.

After you play an invention, tuck it under this card. For the rest of the game, its invention bonus applies.

cards.title: Shell Insertion
cards.basicText:
Choose two different effects:
- each opponent discards 1 card.
- move a friendly fighter up to 2 spaces.
- put a card from your hand on the bottom of your deck to gain 1 action.
- shuffle 2 random cards from your discard pile into your deck.
